author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

I feel this name has the chance to create confusion. The word `Precompile` widely used almost as a reserved word in the community, people talk about "precompile this" and "precompile that". A package with the same name would confuse newer users, IMO.
Seems far-fetched that someone would be confused, IMO. Also, that argument has not been used in the past for package names.

Thanks, Fredrik.

@aviks That's a fair point. For what it's worth, I've briefly talked about this package with Shuhei Kadowaki and Tim Holy and they both responded positively. The idea started with a PR at Pluto where **one** precompile statement reduces the time for first X from 11 to 8 seconds (https://github.com/fonsp/Pluto.jl/pull/1934) while only introducing 0.2 seconds to `@time using Pluto`.

I also think the name Precompile.jl is fine, but an alternative could be something like: *`PrecompileMarkers.jl`* or *`PrecompileHints.jl`*. It's more verbose, but perhaps closer to what the package does: Precompile.jl does not precompile, it marks something as precompilable.

I'm a bit torn here. Yes, the name is very generic and therefore I understand that is an issue. On the other hand, I cannot think of any other use-case for this name and also  `Memoize.jl` which exports `@memoize` is also not called `MemoizeMacro` or whatever.

It would also be a bit sad having to type "using PrecompileMacro: @precompile" or something. Preferably, this macro would have been in Julia base since 1.6, but having a package Precompile is quite reasonable too, I think.

As a compromise, I've now added Tim and Fredrik as a collaborator to the package. This mitigates the issue where I disappear or whatever and people cannot get hold of the name anymore. I'm also happy to move the repo into an organisation if that's preferred.

Whatever. Iâ€™ll change the name. 

This PR can be closed

Seems like a useful tool!

It might also be worth proposing adding it to Base and if successful adding it to Compat.jl for <1.9 support.

Thanks @rikhuijzer for agreeing to change the name. I have no doubt this is a very useful package. But I feel strongly, based on personal experience, that this kind of name clashes are confusing to beginners.

body:
- Registering package: Precompile
